alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Basin; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 7:22PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Weber... southeastern Cache...southern Rich...northern Wasatch...northwestern Duchesne...Morgan...Summit...northeastern Utah and western Uinta Counties through 815 PM MDT... At 722 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 20 miles east of North Ogden to 7 miles southeast of Timber Lakes. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Evanston, Park City, Morgan, Coalville, Heber City, Heber, Summit Park, Kamas, Oakley, Francis, Daniel, Woodruff, Wanship, South Snyderville Basin, Samak, East Canyon State Park, North Snyderville Basin, Mirror Lake, Timber Lakes and Midway. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 84 between mile markers 102 and 119. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 142 and 196. US Route 40 between mile markers 0 and 36. Utah Route 35 between mile markers 0 and 40. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 0 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
